titlestmt.titleproper: J. Walter Thompson Company. Chicago Office. Information Center Records
Guide to the J. Walter Thompson Company. Chicago Office. Information Center Records, 1901-2005 and undated RL.11121
titlestmt.author: Richard Collier

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-01-23 11:16:12 -0500.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: J. Walter Thompson Company. Chicago Office. Information Center Records

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: J. Walter Thompson Company. Chicago Office

origination.label: source
origination.corpname: John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History

did.abstract: Founded in 1864, the J. Walter Thompson Company (JWT) is one of the oldest and largest enduring advertising agencies in the United States. The Chicago Office opened in 1891. The Information Center served as a corporate research library and reference center for the agency.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged into the following series: Administrative Files; Advertising; Research Reports; Special Markets Reports; and Oversize Materials.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The J. Walter Thompson Company. Chicago Office. Information Center Records were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2001-2004.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], J. Walter Thompson Company. Chicago Office. Information Center Records, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Richard Collier, February 2016; additions processed March 2018;
Accessions described in this collection guide: 2001-0199, 2004-0104, 2009-0188

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related materials may be found in the following Hartman Center Collections:

J. Walter Thompson Company Information Center Records; J. Walter Thompson Company Chicago Office Information Center Vertical Files; J. Walter Thompson Company Information Center Vertical Files; Douglass Alligood Records.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection and includes memoranda, clippings, research reports and other materials. Subjects addressed include contests, free-standing advertising inserts, coupons and other promotions, marketing of a variety of products including tobacco, hair care and other toiletries, foods including soy protein meat substitutes. Demographic research topics include marketing to children and youth, African Americans, Hispanic Americans, Asian Americans, older consumers, baby boom generation and women. Companies represented include Procter & Gamble, Andrew Jergens, Aunt Jemima and Unilever. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.
